section.title: Index Range Scan (limit=1)

figure.programlisting: "select m from Movie m where m.title = :title", params={title=Tremors(m836199)}, limit=1

figure.title: Generated SQL
figure.programlisting: select * from ( select movie0_.ID as ID1_2_, movie0_.DIRECTOR_ID as DIRECTOR7_2_, movie0_.MINUTES as MINUTES2_2_, movie0_.PLOT as PLOT3_2_, movie0_.RATING as RATING4_2_, movie0_.RELEASE_DATE as RELEASE5_2_, movie0_.utitle as utitle6_2_ from JPATUNE_MOVIE movie0_ where movie0_.utitle=? ) where rownum <= ?

section.title: Unique Scan
section.para: Request N rows matching a specific criteria using a unique index

figure.title: JPA Query
Generated SQL
figure.programlisting: select movie0_.ID as ID1_2_, movie0_.DIRECTOR_ID as DIRECTOR7_2_, movie0_.MINUTES as MINUTES2_2_, movie0_.PLOT as PLOT3_2_, movie0_.RATING as RATING4_2_, movie0_.RELEASE_DATE as RELEASE5_2_, movie0_.utitle as utitle6_2_ from JPATUNE_MOVIE movie0_ where movie0_.utitle=?

listitem.para: Index used to locate table rowId
Unique index scan used since index contains unique values

tip.title: Unique Indexes are more Efficient than Non-Unique Indexes for Specific Value Search
tip.para: DB knows there can be only a single match and stops index scan after first match found

section.title: Bypassing Table Access with Composite Index
Query Parts
section.para: Selecting N columns from M rows matching Q criteria terms

figure.title: JPA Query
figure.programlisting: "select m.rating from Movie m where m.title like :title", params={title=A%}, limit=2000

figure.title: Generated SQL
figure.programlisting: select * from ( select movie0_.RATING as col_0_0_ from JPATUNE_MOVIE movie0_ where movie0_.TITLE like ? ) where rownum <= ?

section.title: Option: Use Range Scan and RowId Access

listitem.para: Where clause satisfied using an index range scan
Select clause satisfied using table access by rowId from index

section.title: Option: Use Range Scan Alone with Composite Index

figure.title: DB Index(es)
figure.programlisting: create index movie_title_rating_idx on jpatune_movie(title, rating)

section.para: * this index contains columns from both the where and select clauses

listitem.para: Where clause satisfied using an index range scan
Select clause satisfied using same index since composite index also contains all necessary columns

tip.title: Add Columns from Select to Composite Index to Bypass Table Access
tip.para: DB will bypass rowId access to row if index already contains all columns necessary to satisfy the select clause.

section.title: Option: Use Range Scan and RowId Access

figure.title: DB Index(es)
figure.programlisting: create index movie_rating_title_idx on jpatune_movie(rating, title)

section.para: * this index is the mirror image of previous example and contains columns from both the select and where clauses

listitem.para: Index did not start with terms from where clause, but usable
Where clause satisfied using a fast full scan of composite index
Select clause satisfied using same index since composite index also contains all necessary columns
